name: Qat'Muk Indigenous Protected and Conserved Area
governance_authority: Ktunaxa Nation Council, the Government of Canada, the Province of British Columbia and Nature Conservancy of Canada
planned_actions: To expand an existing area
description: The Ktunaxa Nation Council envisions the IPCA area spanning about 170,000 acres immediately north of the Purcell Wilderness Conservancy and encompassing the Jumbo Valley and parts of adjacent watersheds. Dialogue between the parties is ongoing to refine the boundaries and stewardship objectives, and to consult with other stakeholders. The goal is for the Qatâ€™muk Indigenous Protected and Conserved Area to be formally established by mid- 2021.

name: Growing Mongolia's Protected Area Estate
governance_authority: TNC provide the Government of Mongolia with technical assistance that led the Mongolian Parliament

name: The Badger-Two Medicine
planned_actions: To improve management of an existing area
description: The Badger-Two Medicine is a place of deep cultural and spiritual significance to the Blackfeet Nation.

name: Balhaf Headland Marine Area
planned_actions: To collaborate with the managers of neighbouring area to improve conservation in the landscape/seascape
description: conserving the marine area of the industrial site

name: Cinco Grandes Reserve
planned_actions: To expand an existing area
description: restoration of a hunting concessions

name: Lizardsâ€™ Lane
planned_actions: To expand an existing area
description: protection of the source of spring water

description: management of a large forested area

name: Sinyala Village Forest Area
planned_actions: To create a new area
description: community based conservation

name: Fazenda Lagoa
planned_actions: To improve governance of an existing area
description: Fazenda Lagoa VCA is part of a movement to demonstrate that alternative and dependable income can be generated from sustainable agricultural practices and forest preservation. With climate change generally reducing the regional rainfall patterns, shifting away from destructive forms of land use is key to effective and long-term water management, essential to the area’s human inhabitants and biodiversity.

name: Green circle Bee landscape
planned_actions: To improve management of an existing area
description: Commitment from the over 40 partners of the Green Circle Bee-landscape to collaborate towards the sustainable management of land. The regional environmental protection agency, West Holland, has developed a social network of dedicated actors managing diverse habitats. By providing relevant information and experience on designing and maintaining the ecologically sustainable network for pollinators is enhanced and strengthened. Through this project, the province of South Holland has the ambition to become the most bee-friendly province in the Netherlands

name: Jardines Ángel del Sol
planned_actions: To improve management of an existing area
description: This VCA is managed by the Asociación de Productores Agropecuarios La Primavera in the San Martin department. The Asociación is the legal management authority for the proposed VCA. The Association has 30 members which comprises about 10 percent of all the coffee farms of the Paujil stream area and focusses on organic coffee production. The intention is that over time more farmers will join the Asociación and the VCA area increases slowly.

name: Nanga Lauk Village Forest
primary_objectives: Biodiversity conservation;Sustainable use;Preservation of traditional livelihoods
planned_actions: To collaborate with the managers of neighbouring area to improve conservation in the landscape/seascape
description: With the support of the local NGO PRCF-Indonesia, and a team of local and international experts, the Nanga Lauk community designed a suite of activities to secure and extend their legal right to manage and benefit from their Village Forest, enabling them to prevent the deforestation and forest degradation that would result if the area is not effectively protected

name: Alvelal Territory
planned_actions: To collaborate with the managers of neighbouring area to improve conservation in the landscape/seascape
description: Alvelal has drafted a Natural Zones Restoration Plan 2017-2022, focused on restoring key degraded natural areas in the territory, with the goal of creating biodiversity corridors between protected areas

name: Sinyala Village Forest Area
planned_actions: To collaborate with the managers of neighbouring area to improve conservation in the landscape/seascape
description: Sinyala Village Forest Area (VFA) is located in central Malawi in Lilongwe district. The VFA land is covered with indigenous trees and is under the protection of community people from Sinyala village led by the Traditional Authority. Masumbankhunda by the act of Government on Community Forestry in Malawi Forest Act 1997. The VFA was established by Chief Sinyala who visionally realised that with time the area will be depleted of wildlife.

name: Kep Archipelago Hope Spot
planned_actions: To improve management of an existing area
description: The Marine Conservation Cambodia (MCC), works through research, direct conservation practices and local activism to reverse some of the negative impacts. There are multiple actions to the work of MCC from dedicated species research, protection activities, habitat restoration, fisheries managment and policy activities and awarness raising activities.

name: Datan Algal Reef Hope Spot
planned_actions: To improve management of an existing area
description: The algal reef along the Taoyuan coast is a traditional fishing ground for local villages, providing a food source and income outside of the major rice farming seasons.  The Datan algal reef is perhaps the areaâ€™s healthiest in terms of reef structure, coverage, and biodiversity, making it incredibly vital to shield it from suffering the same fate as its surrounding reefs. The Datan algal reef is the largest biotic structure, thus providing its reef-associated species a connection to northern populations in Japan. However, the reef is highly degraded and still unnder threat. It is estimated that about 75% of the reef (the northern region of the reef) has been damaged by industrial pollution in the last 50 years.

name: Salisbury Island Hope Spot
planned_actions: To extend the planned lifespan of an existing area
description: Remote ecosystem through observation and promote virtual tourism here rather than physical tourism to minimize the human impact on this sensitive location. Conservationists working for Finding Salisbury, Inc. are seeking official government protection to maintain the areaâ€™s stable condition with a comprehensive no-take state marine reserve and a â€œvirtual tourismâ€ program to allow the public virtual access while keeping the area wild.

name: Kimbe Bay Hope Spot
planned_actions: To extend the planned lifespan of an existing area
description: The Kimbe Bay battles the negative effects of local human population growth, the expansion of offshore fishing efforts, seabed mining, pollution and warming water temperatures. Hope Spot Champions Cecilie Benjamin and Gemma Galbraith and the students of Marine Environment Education Program (MEEP) are leading the cause to improve enforcement of the areas LMMAs (Locally Managed Marine Areas) and MPAs and to expand their program to continue educating Kimbe Bays youth about reef conservation.

name: Whale and Dolphin Sanctuary of Uruguay Hope Spot
planned_actions: To collaborate with the managers of neighbouring area to improve conservation in the landscape/seascape
description: The Whale and Dolphin Sanctuary of Uruguay has been declared a Hope Spot by international nonprofit Mission Blue in recognition of its value as a safe haven for cetaceans, to establish an enforceable policy to thoroughly manage and protect the sanctuary and to educate the public aboutÂ the negative effects of â€œocean noiseâ€Â on marine life created by oil drilling, shipping and seismic testing.
